Package com.examapp.controllers

Class AuthorityController

java.lang.Object
com.examapp.controllers.AuthorityController
@CrossOrigin @RestController @RequestMapping("authority") public class AuthorityController extends Object
  • Handles operations related to student authority management.
  • APIs available:
    1. Retrieve a list of students for a specified class (getStudentList)
    2. Grant permissions to students based on provided authority list (setAuthorities)
  • All endpoint require token obtained from logging in
  • Teacher specific:
    • getStudentList
    • setAuthorities

  • Method Details

    • getStudentList

      @GetMapping("/authoritystudentList/{classname}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<String>> getStudentList(@PathVariable("classname") String classname)
      GET - Handles requests to retrieve a list of students for a specified class. This method maps to the endpoint "/authority/studentList/{classname}" and retrieves the student list associated with the provided class name. It uses the authorityMapper to access the data layer and fetch the relevant student information.

      Note: This operation can only be performed by a teacher.

      Ensure to include a Bearer token in the request header for authentication.

      Return values:

      • 200 OK with a list of student names if the retrieval is successful.
      • 404 Not Found if no students are found for the specified class.

      Example response for a successful retrieval:

       [
     "Alice",
     "Bob",
     "Charlie"
 ]

      Example response for no students found:

       []
      Parameters:
      classname - The name of the class for which to retrieve the student list.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of student names as strings.

    • setAuthorities

      @PutMapping("setAuthorities") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> setAuthorities(@RequestBody List<Authority> authorityList)
      PUT - Grants permissions to students for a specified class based on the provided authority list. This method handles requests to the "/authority/setAuthorities" endpoint. It checks the provided list of authorities to ensure that all users in the list are recorded as students in the database. If any user is not found or if the input list is invalid (null or empty), the request will be rejected with a 400 Bad Request response.

      Note: This operation can only be performed by a teacher.

      Ensure to include a Bearer token in the request header for authentication.

      Parameters:
      authorityList - A list of Authority objects representing the students and their associated permissions. Each Authority must correspond to a valid student in the database. Example JSON representation: 
                            [
                          {
                              "username": "Jacky",
                              "permission": "Linear algebra"
                          },
                          {
                              "username": "Jacky",
                              "permission": "University Calculus"
                          }
                      ]
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the outcome of the operation:
      • 200 OK if permissions were successfully granted.
      • 400 Bad Request if the input list is null, empty, or contains invalid users.
